Academic Preparation Kit

Dear Participants,

Contained in this website is the academic preparation kit for RS Lausanne 2016. Before arriving at the session, it is vital that you prepare yourself. Coming up with a solution to a problem you know nothing about is fairly difficult, so we have put together this academic preparation kit for you which outlines both the topics at the session and the EU as a whole. You should at the very least read your own topic overview - but the preparation does not end there. Included in all the overviews are links for further research - these are a good starting point to widen your view on the topic. The more effort you put into preparing yourself, the more you can contribute to your committee and its resolution at the session.

Happy reading!

The Chairs

The EU's Institutions - An Overview

Topic Overviews

CRIM

Fighting illegal drugs and organised crime

Illegal drug trade in the EU is estimated to be worth as high as 100 billion dollars. Following the adoption of the 2013-2020 EU Drugs Strategy, what additional measures should European Institutions take to help Member States in the fight against illegal drug markets run by organised crime groups?

FEMM

Equal opportunities in all areas of the workforce

While female workforce participation as a whole is improving on many fronts, many occupations and positions tend to be largely male or female dominated. What should the EU do to balance its current workforce and inspire young Europeans to take up non traditional occupations?

ITRE

Nuclear Powers Place in Europe's Future

The 2015 Paris Agreement on climate change set the goal of "holding the increase in the global average temperature to well below two Degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels". What role, if any, should nuclear power play in reaching this goal and ensuring a sustainable and reliable energy supply for Europe?

JURI I

International vs Domestic Law

A recently launched popular initiative demands that obligations of international law should only be subordinate to the Swiss constitution and Swiss domestic law. Bearing in mind the impact this may have on the authority of the European Court of Human Rights, should every European country be free to decide on the relation between its domestic and international law?

JURI II

From Corruption to Transparency

From straight out bribing to arrangements with high profiled public officials: After recent scandals of high level corruption in both private and public sector, which steps should the EU and its Member States take towards more transparency and accountability?

LIBE I

Xenophobia, Immigration, Logistics

Learning from our mistakes: considering Europe’s history of integrating immigrants into society, which steps should Member States be taking to successfully integrate immigrants into society, both regarding logistics and tackling existing xenophobia amongst citizens?

LIBE II

Freedom of movement within the EU

Free movement or annual quotas? Following the results from the Swiss electorate to place restrictions on the free entry of EU workers, what should the stance of the EU be towards Member States and associated states with restrictive immigration policies towards EU citizens?

TRAN

Fostering Sustainable Tourism

In light of the COP21 Agreement in Paris, it is understood that all industries have a part to play in reducing carbon emissions. How can a culture of “sustainable tourism” be fostered in Europe, ensuring the future conservation of the environment whilst increasing tourism trade?
